card: INFRA - processes terminating from "Timeout Expired" exceptions when attempting to communicate with the database
description:
**ISSUE**
process terminated with error message "Execution Timeout Expired.  The timeout period elapsed prior to completion of the operation or the server is not responding." & "The request channel timed out while waiting for a reply after 00:00:00. Increase the timeout value passed to the call to Request or increase the SendTimeout value on the Binding. The time allotted to this operation may have been a portion of a longer timeout."

**IMPACT**
processes terminate when attempting to load cases to the Queue

**ROOT-CAUSE**
Database performing slowly because of the "BPASessionLog_NonUnicode" and "BPASessionLog_NonUnicode_pre65" tables being larger then expected. Blue Prism recommends that the SessionLog tables have automatic archiving setup on them so that they do not build up to overly large amounts. This automatic archiving was not originally setup when the environment was initially deployed.

**WORK-AROUND**
Monitor the environment and restart processes when needed

**RESOLUTION**
1. Clean the "BPASessionLog_NonUnicode_pre65" table: Remove the table from the Blue Prism database as recommended by Blue Prism (see "confirmation on dropping pre65 table.pdf").
2. Clean the "BPASessionLog_NonUnicode" table: Run the "remove-logs.sql" script on the Dev Environment to test the outcome. The table was cleaned, however an unexpected error message occurred after the table was cleaned (An explicit value for the identity column in table 'BPASessionLog_NonUnicode' can only be specified when a column list is used and IDENTITY_INSERT is ON.) which caused the script to attempt to rollback. However, when the script attempted to rollback it failed and the outcome was that the 'BPASessionLog_NonUnicode' stayed cleaned.

**LESSONS**
GOOD: Communication with Users, Customers and Sponsors to keep them updated on the problem as well as the collaboration with ICT to resolve the problem was excellent.
IMPROVEMENT: Communication and responsiveness from the Blue Prism Vendor to assist with resolving the issue could have been better. Additionally next time an environment database is setup we will make sure to check the automated archiving is setup.
LUCKY: We have access to run scripts on the database for root-cause analysis and resolution.

card: INFRA - schedules failing to run process tasks
description:
**ISSUE:**
Schedules failing to run process tasks. The Schedule often starts, however its unable to start some of the tasks and so "Aborts" that task, which then starts the next task that is selected in the Schedule.

**IMPACT:**
Tasks that are supposed to run certain processes dont run and get skipped

**ROOT-CAUSE:**
Current hypothesis is that processes time out when attempting to query the database to start the Tasks because the fragementation percentage of certain tables in the database is too high (session table, process table, logs table). This high fragmentation could be caused by (1) high INSERT and DELETE operations to the tables and / or (2) the fact that the database is hosted on a shared SQL server. The excel document titled "Problem Analysis" includes the Application Event logs from 4 VMs that experienced this Problem between the 20th and the 25th of July. In each of the 4 examples, the same occurance is found where a process will complete however it fails to mark the process as COMPLETE in the Blue Prism database Session table (e.g. "Failed to set session status on d2e7ce8f-2ead-4f9c-86e5-3d21891ae7a9 to COMPLETED : Execution Timeout Expired.  The timeout period elapsed prior to completion of the operation or the server is not responding."). This timeout then prevents the next scheduled task to run until at least a minute has passed (see P6 and P50 examples in excel document). The timeout prevents any other scheduled tasks from running because the VM connection gets aborted, showing an "Warning" error in the Application Event Logs (e.g. "Disconnected 10.83.28.96 - System.IO.IOException: Unable to write data to the transport connection: An established connection was aborted by the software in your host machine. ---> System.Net.Sockets.SocketException: An established connection was aborted by the software in your host machine"). 

**WORK-AROUND:**
1. assess impact
2. contact business if impact is high
2. re-run process if possible

**RESOLUTION:**
Build script that regularly cleans the Fragmentation of the Database.

**LESSONS (good, bad, lucky):**

Run bot in debug mode and breakpoint on the main page recover stage to stop the bot and manually process the exception. 

2.
Rely on existing exception handling to write out the output data as per the existing code.

RESOLUTION:
